CSB vacant codes

csb_vacant.Rd

csb_vacantappends a logical vector indicating `TRUE` for vacancy related problem codes.

csb_vacant(.data, var, newVar, filter = FALSE)

Arguments

.data

A tibble with raw CSB data
var

name of column containing problem codes
newVar

name of output variable to be created with vacant logical
filter

If true, returns a filtered version of the input with only vacancy related problem codes

Value

csb_vacantreturns a logical vector with TRUE for vacancy related problem codes, or a filtered version of the input data

Examples

csb_vacant(january_2018, PROBLEMCODE, vacant)
#> # A tibble: 1,688 x 20
#>    CALLERTYPE DATECANCELLED       DATEINVTDONE        DATETIMECLOSED     
#>    <chr>      <dttm>              <dttm>              <dttm>             
#>  1 WEB        NA                  2018-01-05 16:22:19 2018-01-05 16:22:21
#>  2 WEB        NA                  2018-01-05 16:22:19 2018-01-05 16:22:21
#>  3 WEB        NA                  NA                  NA                 
#>  4 WEB        NA                  2018-01-05 16:17:41 2018-01-05 16:18:08
#>  5 PHONE      NA                  2018-01-01 10:40:14 2018-01-01 10:40:54
#>  6 WEB        NA                  2018-01-02 12:54:41 2018-01-12 10:27:12
#>  7 PHONE      NA                  2018-01-03 11:22:29 2018-01-03 11:22:29
#>  8 PHONE      NA                  2018-01-03 11:19:13 2018-01-03 11:19:13
#>  9 WEB        NA                  2018-01-05 16:16:55 2018-01-05 16:17:28
#> 10 PHONE      NA                  2017-12-29 20:00:00 2018-01-01 15:01:19
#> # … with 1,678 more rows, and 16 more variables: DATETIMEINIT <dttm>,

#> #   PROBADDRESS <chr>, PROBADDTYPE <chr>, PROBCITY <chr>, PROBLEMCODE <chr>,
#> #   PROBZIP <int>, REQUESTID <int>, SRX <dbl>, SRY <dbl>, STATUS <chr>,
#> #   SUBMITTO <chr>, WARD <int>, vacant <lgl>
